Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2007 06:01PM Debbie21 wrote: I went for breast cancer risk counseling at a well known highly rated teaching & research hospital which was one of the first to do studies on the value of MRIs and Ultrasounds for high risk/lower risk woman. The doctor said MRIs are recommended for high risk woman with dense breasts. However, its done with the mammogram (at the same appointment). The doctor said some facilities do them 6 months apart but that is not the best way. Together they raise the % of detection significantly. They complement each other. But MRIs also have a high false positive rate depending on the skill of the person doing and interpreting it. The hospital I went to has Doctors doing the MRIs and they have a much lower false positive rate than most hospitals. I chose to do ultra sound with my mammograms, since the false positive rate is lower and with a mammogram increase detection up to 97%
